news.title: Higher tariffs are kicking in. Here's what Walmart and other retailers said about their impact
news.summary: Consumer spending has largely stayed strong so far. The pinch from higher duties hasn't been as severe as some companies had feared. The U.S. economy is expected to grow at a strong rate in the second quarter.

news.title: U.S. government takes 10% stake in Intel, as Trump expands control over private sector
news.summary: The U.S. government has taken a 10% stake in chipmaker Intel. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the move was in the interest of national security.

news.title: Businesses bringing back recession specials could be the latest sign of deteriorating consumer sentiment
news.summary: The term "recession" has popped up again as a selling point this summer. It may provide a look at how businesses are reacting to consumer sentiment.

news.title: Medtronic makes two key additions to its board. How activist Elliott can build shareholder value
news.summary: The stage seems to be set for a long-term mutually beneficial relationship between the parties. The stage is set for the two countries to work together for the betterment of the world.

news.title: Ghislaine Maxwell interview released by DOJ; Epstein procurer questioned about Trump
news.summary: The Trump administration has been criticized for reneging on promises to release files about sex offenders Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The White House has said it will release files on Epstein and Maxwell.

news.title: Who can actually buy a house today? Meet the ‘elite’ buyers achieving the American dream.
news.summary: The share of first-time home buyers is at a historic low. Yet they haven’t entirely disappeared. The U.S. housing market is booming, but it’s still a long way from full recovery.

news.title: ‘It’s like a psychological ceiling’: Why fast-food chains are trying to stay below $10 in their pricing
news.summary: Consumers don’t consider it a bargain if you cross into double-digit territory, experts say. The average price of a home in the U.S. is about $1.2 million.

news.title: ‘I’ve been kept in poverty’: Do I take a $70K job at 74 and lose my Section 8 housing allowance?
news.summary: “After the age of 50, I really only had sporadic contract work and I had to sell my house,” he says.

news.title: I’m 32 and only have $8,000 saved in my 401(k) so far. How do I get more aggressive?
news.summary: The answer doesn’t have anything to do with which investments you choose. The answer is that it’s up to you.

news.title: Please stop asking me to be your best man — I’ve spent $4,400 on one wedding and can’t afford it anymore
news.summary: The wedding will cost me thousands of dollars. Guilt over how good a friend I am is colliding with the financial reality that this wedding is costing me thousands.
